radiographic_examinations.findings: Severe dynamic left ventricular outflow tract (LVOT) obstruction and significant mitral valve systolic anterior motion resulting in moderate-to-severe mitral regurgitation. Normal left and right ventricular volumes and ejection fraction (EF 55%) pre-myectomy.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Post-surgical resting echocardiography demonstrated a significant reduction in LVOT gradient (now 5 mmHg).

radiographic_examinations.findings: A large calibre first septal perforating artery extending to the endocardial border of the LVOT with probable communication with the LV cavity.
Confirmed a fistula between an unroofed first septal perforator and the LV cavity.
Demonstrated septal post-surgical wall motion changes and an ejection fraction (EF) of 59%, with no evidence of myocardial ischaemia.
